Name: Fragment of an offering list
Description: The left side of this fragment shows the remains of an offering table. Underneath the table are offerings and indications of their number. On the right is an offering list depicting clothing, material, vessels and tools. Writing down the names of the offerings was considered just as effective for the afterlife as the real objects that were placed inside the tomb. Basically there are two types of offering list: the ritual offering list contains all the things needed by the deceased in the context of the ritual of the food offering. The funerary equipment, however, was listed in the inventory offering list, consisting of separate lists of tools, vessels, clothing, etc.
